descriptions: The student shows no ability to identify relevant foundational works of American literature from the specified period.
The student struggles to identify foundational works, and the selections are largely inaccurate or irrelevant.
The student can identify one relevant foundational work, but struggles with providing context or further examples.
The student identifies two relevant foundational works but does not elaborate on their significance.
The student accurately identifies multiple foundational works of American literature from the eighteenth, nineteenth, and early-twentieth centuries and briefly explains their significance.
The student expertly identifies several foundational works, providing insightful commentary on their historical and cultural context.
The student demonstrates no understanding of themes or topics present in American Literature
The student demonstrates minimal understanding of themes or topics, offering responses that are mostly incorrect.
The student vaguely identifies a theme or topic without providing supporting details.
The student is able to identify a theme and provide a somewhat accurate description of one work of literature that relates to it.
The student clearly identifies a theme or topic and accurately connects it to at least two works of literature.
The student offers a nuanced explanation of one or more themes or topics, demonstrating an advanced level of comprehension.
The student doesn't attempt to compare texts or their themes.
The student makes a vague attempt to compare texts, but the comparison is inaccurate and irrelevant.
The student presents a superficial comparison that identifies a similarity, but lacks depth and insight.
The student compares two texts, identifying one or two basic similarities or differences in themes or topics.
The student draws thoughtful comparisons between texts, highlighting similarities and differences in how they address specific themes or topics.
The student provides a sophisticated analysis of how multiple texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics, showcasing a deep understanding of literary connections and nuances.
